title: Max Planck Institure | serif + sans serif?
author: spirelli

comments.content: Looks like Arial ( [squoosh](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017173555/http:/typophile.com/wiki/squoosh)ed) on the right.

I like the way he spells his last name!

The Truth shall set you free

Times Roman and Arial. Is that it?  
Many thanks.

Hey everyone, can I ask for your help again?  
I've found what's considered as the 'original'.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017173555im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_mpi_3594.gif)

The second typeface is Helvetica Condensed and Helvetica Condensed Bold.  
But what is the serif typeface?

Thanks for any help again :)

Looks like [Bodoni Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017173555/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/bodoni/).

Are you sure the ones on the right are Helvetica Condensed and Helvetica Condensed Bold? To me they seem like they could be condensed weights of [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017173555/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers/).

Do you have a larger image?

Thanks Conor!  
No larger image available.

But when I blow that up in Illustrator an lay Helvetica Condensed on top it looks like a pretty good match.
